title: Distributed Variational Inference in Sparse Gaussian Process Regression and Latent Variable Models
abstract: The recently developed Bayesian Gaussian process latent variable model (GPLVM) is a powerful generative model for discovering low dimensional embeddings in linear time complexity. However, modern datasets are so large that even linear-time models find them difficult to cope with. We introduce a novel re-parametrisation of variational inference for the GPLVM and sparse GP model that allows for an efficient distributed inference algorithm.
